_header: Alas what ruleth the bridle rein
Versification: — four-line, seven-line, two-line — abab, ababbcc, aa
_description: An alphabetical poem — seventy-eight lines in 19 stanzas of varying length, each line of a stanza beginning with same word, with ‘Wo worth’ anaphora; some stanzas (like that for ‘q’) in Latin

NottsULMiDc7.First Lines:
Alas wat rulythe the Brydle rayneAlas that I louyd so
                    counsystenceAlas tym past may not returne agaynAlas that I lost al by
                    neglygence…
NottsULMiDc7.Last Lines:
…Wo worth the buyere that [ ] saythwo worth those [ ]stet that
                    s[ ]th can
NottsULMiDc7.Note:
Provenance: ‘A Regestre of [ ] belonging to the Abby of Burton
                    upon Trent made 1474 by Thomas Felde Abbot’ (front cover,
                    recto).
NottsULMiDc7.Editions:
Historical Manuscripts Commission, Report on the Manuscripts of Lord
                Middleton, [formerly] preserved at Wollaton Hall, Nottinghamshire.
         (1911): 267-8.
